posts.name: 9016a
posts.cooked:
Hi!

We’re having problems with connecting to all of our CTRE swerve devices (8 Krakens, 4 CANCoders, 1 Pigeon 2.0).

Everything is on 2025 firmware.

Our wiring starts at the BL Module, goes around, and ends after the BR Module. For each module, the CAN goes through the steer Kraken, then the CANCoder, then the drive Kraken, then to the next module.

Between Module FL and FR (2nd and 3rd on the circuit) is our Pigeon 2.0, wiring going from FL Drive to Pigeon to FR Steer.

When we have the whole circuit completed, only the motors show up, like the screenshot below. image 1901×1057 172 KB

image 1901×1057 172 KB

image 1901×1057 172 KB

When we break the circuit 3/4 of the way there, meaning between Module FR and BR (3rd and 4th module), every device, including all 6 motors, all 3 CANcoders and the Pigeon 2.0 are visible, as per the screenshot below.

image 1869×1063 189 KB

image 1869×1063 189 KB

image 1869×1063 189 KB

We have also tried to reverse the circuit, as in starting at our BR Module and ending at BL, and the same issue. When we cut the circuit 3/4 of the way there, as in between Module FL and Module BL, every device up until that point is seen by Phoenix Tuner X.

No matter which direction the CAN circuit goes, it only sees the Krakens as a full circuit.

We tested resistivity for both Green and Yellow, and we are under 15 ohms (a healthy number) from the beginning to the end of the circuits.

We re-installed Phoenix Tuner X, to no avail.

All of our devices were visible Friday afternoon, the problems started Saturday morning.

We would greatly appreciate it if you guys would have suggestions to try and fix our problem.

Thanks!

posts.name: 9016a
posts.cooked:
UPDATE:

Looking at Driver Station, see that CAN utilization is 100%. This is with the full circuit completed, in the case that only the 8 motors are visible.

This may provide a direction to make sense, but I still don’t understand what I can do.

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked:
Might need to change CAN IDs to unique ID numbers

Start with one motor at a time

posts.name: Chadfrom7226
posts.cooked:
Mehmet1:

We tested resistivity for both Green and Yellow, and we are under 15 ohms (a healthy number) from the beginning to the end of the circuits.

CAN circuits should be 60 ohms

Check for pinched wires or wires that are strung tight around sharp metal edges
can you verify you have a terminating resistor at both ends? and if its on a canivore then the pdp cant be the terminting resistor

posts.name: s-neff
posts.cooked:
Chadfrom7226:

60 ohms

Measured from yellow to green.

The yellow bus and the green bus should individually read near zero.

Sounds like pinch/short or bad choice of termination resistors

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked:
Chadfrom7226:

60 ohms

Isn’t it a 120 ohm resistor at the end?

posts.name: David Racovan
posts.cooked: Two 120Ω resistors in parallel combine to one 60Ω resistor

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked:
Thanks.

We normally hunt error by breaking the CAN and testing both ends both upstream and downstream, we expect 120 on those, but it is no longer parallel once we break it.

posts.name: 9016a
posts.cooked: We’ve also tested with the end of the can circuits in the air not touching each other (hence, a terminating resistor). Also, without a terminating resistor, nothing should show up, right? Not just a few motors?

posts.name: 9016a
posts.cooked: They are all unique. We (and you through the screenshots) see all of the motors, so they don’t appear to be the problem.

posts.name: 9016a
posts.cooked:
s-neff:

Sounds like pinch/short or bad choice of termination resistors

Mehmet1:

can circuits in the air not touching each other (hence, a terminating resistor).

Motors still show up when the CAN wires are held separately in the air as I described.

posts.name: Ashton Demmer
posts.cooked: Are you using a Canivore? A canivore would drop the can utilization drastically. You should be reading 60ohms. Make sure you have a 120ohm resistor at the end. If you aren’t using a canivore and are terminating through the pdh/pdp make sure that the termination is enabled(jumper or switch). If you are using a canivore and external resistor make sure your canivore has the terminating resistor at the start of the bus enabled.

posts.name: 9016a
posts.cooked:
CRITICAL UPDATE:

I set the firmware to everything to 2024 firmware, and then everything is visible in phoenix Tuner X.

The CAN Utilization then fluctuates around 35-50%, which is great.

image 1885×1056 257 KB

image 1885×1056 257 KB

image 1885×1056 257 KB

ashtondemmer:

Are you using a Canivore?

No we are not, but I would expect the normal CAN circuit that could handle 12 Krakens + 4 Canivores + 1 Pigeon 2.0 on 2024 firmware at a comfortable 30-50% should be able to handle the same devices on 2025 firmware, even if at a higher percentage.

The fact that the rio CAN isn’t even enough to see all of the devices in 2025 is concerning.

Is there any way I can reduce the CAN utilization from my devices? Keep in mind, there isn’t any code running on the Rio.

We ordered a CANivore a while back but we don’t know when it will arrive.

posts.name: Tom Line
posts.cooked: I would continue to chase wiring.  Start with One motor.  Then the cancoder.  Then the next.  If you are having problems with the Rio, the Canivore can be even more picky with its higher speed bus.

posts.name: 9016a
posts.cooked:
Mehmet1:

everything is visible in phoenix Tuner X

Is my wiring supposed to change between 2024 and 2025 firmware?
Utilization does not represent anything, and if all motors are visible in Phoenix Tuner, and devices like TalonFX and Pigeon light up orange when the robot is disabled, there will be no problems.

posts.name: 9016a
posts.cooked:
frcboss:

if all motors are visible in Phoenix Tuner

Unfortunately they are not, when in 2025 firmware. In 2024 firmware, they are all visible.

frcboss:

TalonFX and Pigeon light up orange when the robot is disabled, there will be no problems.

When in 2025 firmware and when I see the Kraken Motors in Phoenix Tuner X (but not the CANCoders or the Pigeon), I can deploy code but it doesn’t run.

posts.name: Alex Weiss
posts.cooked: If you can see everything on 2024 firmware, do the motors or other devices need to be updated to the 2025 version? This may not resolve it, but worth a try.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Did you update your RoboRIO? Check the version with the imaging tool.

data.fancy_title: CTRE Swerve Wiring Issue - This makes no sense?
data.title: CTRE Swerve Wiring Issue - This makes no sense?

accepted_answer.excerpt: Another update: I think we found our issue. We reimaged our Roborio 2, and we could connect and see all of our devices. Once I deployed code, however, then it would lose everything once again. I looked over the code, and it turns out that a super high frequency was the issue. [image] I’ll tes…
